intro: Adenophora nikoensis f. multifida, commonly known as the multifid leaf adenophora, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant is distinguished by its finely divided, multifid leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
